meanings.definition: Capable of being produced or generated.
meanings.sent1: The machine had a generable design, making it easy to replicate.
meanings.sent2: The seeds were generable, ready to sprout into beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent3: The generable idea of a flying car seemed amusing until it became a reality.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was generable, spreading joy like a contagious virus.
meanings.sent5: The generable energy of the sun fueled all life on Earth.

meanings.definition: Able to give rise to something.
meanings.sent1: His generable actions inspired others to follow in his footsteps.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's encouragement was generable, leading to students' success.
meanings.sent3: The generable support from the community lifted everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was generable, brightening even the gloomiest of days.
meanings.sent5: The generable impact of kindness can create a ripple effect of positivity.

meanings.definition: Able to be created or formed.
meanings.sent1: The generable clay could be molded into any shape imaginable.
meanings.sent2: The artist's vision was generable, turning blank canvases into masterpieces.
meanings.sent3: The generable possibilities of the future excited the young inventor.
meanings.sent4: Her words were generable, crafting stories that captivated audiences.
meanings.sent5: The generable potential of the human mind knows no bounds.
